intro: Telis elliptica, commonly known as the narrowleaf telis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its elliptical, narrow leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
